name: Those in "The Dead Zone" Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: Prior to the car accident which granted him psychic powers, what was Johnny's occupation?
questions.explanation:
High school Science teacher.

	Johnny was dating Sarah Bracknell, the high school Choir teacher. Johnny was played by Anthony Michael Hall and Sarah was played by Nicole DeBoer.

questions.text: Sarah gives birth to a child at the start of the sixth season. What is her name?
questions.explanation:
Hope.

	During Johnny's coma following his car crash, Sarah married Walt Bannerman, the town sheriff. Bannerman died in a church fire at the start of season six, but his wife gave birth to his daughter at the same time. Walt was played by Chris Bruno.

questions.text: Bruce Lewis compares Johnny's brain on drugs to corned beef hash.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Bruce compared it to scrambled eggs. Bruce was played by John L. Adams and appeared in the first six seasons. Bruce was Johnny's partner-in-crime and was the rational one of the pair.

questions.text: Dana Bright worked for the Bangor Daily Mail.
questions.explanation:
False.

	She worked for the "Bangor Daily News". She frequently hung around the police station fishing for breaking crime stories. She reported on many of Johnny's early cases and later began a relationship with him. She was played by Kristen Dalton and appeared in seasons one, two, and five.

questions.text: Which character was Reverend Purdy in love with?
questions.explanation:
Vera Smith.

	Vera Smith was Johnny's mother who killed herself in despair after hearing of Johnny's car crash. Reverend Purdy, who had been in love with her for over thirty-five years, told the public she had passed away due to a heart attack. Purdy was a guest star for the first six seasons and left town at the end of the sixth season.

questions.text: Greg Stillson's childhood job was what?
questions.explanation:
A door-to-door 'Bible' salesman.

	Greg Stillson is a mentally unstable politician who is at the center of Johnny's apocalyptic visions. As charismatic as he is troubled, he is played by Sean Patrick Flanery. The two characters first met when Stillson went to Smith's childhood home on a Bible-selling stint.

questions.text: J.J. Bannerman was played by Spencer Achtymichuk in the first five seasons. Who portrayed the character in season six?
questions.explanation:
Connor Price.

	J.J. is the son of Sarah and Johnny, although Walt had been raising the child as his own. J.J. learned that Johnny was his father in Season Three, and has displayed psychic powers of his own.

questions.text: Malcolm Janus is an ardent supporter of which other character?
questions.explanation:
Greg Stillson.

	Janus was a member of a shady organization who granted Reverend Purdy a global sphere of influence and desired to see Stillson in the White House. He was killed by Purdy in season six.

questions.text: This child psychiatrist bought a gun to kill Greg Stillson.
questions.explanation:
Rebecca Caldwell.

	Rebecca Caldwell was played by Sarah Wynter and appeared in the third and fourth seasons. She believed that Stillson murdered her sister Rachel and bought a gun so that she could take his life. Johnny stopped her, and Rebecca found out that Stillson did not kill Rachel.

questions.text: Which event led Alex Sinclair to discover her "dead zone"?
questions.correct: Being stung by a swarm of bees
options: Being shot in a hunting accident
questions.explanation:
Being stung by a swarm of bees.

	Alex Sinclair first appeared in the episode "Double Vision" where she and Johnny subdued a sniper. She later appeared in another fourth season episode, "A Very Dead Zone Christmas", where she showed romantic feelings toward Johnny.
